text:
hi guys welcome to another episode of Pai's 
Thailand food blog where I show you the

everyday Thai food culture through the everyday 
stuff that I eat while I'm here so today just

having some lunch at home my aunt's got a hold 
of some live crafts we went and picked it up

this morning and then my grandmother turned it 
into this yummy looking thing it's basically crap

stir-fried with glass noodles with just garlic and 
pepper and soy sauce and it looks very very good

and then beside it is the seafood dipping sauce 
I've done a video on this now this is green and

mine was red only because they use green chillies 
instead of red chillies they used a little bit of

red chillies as you can see so we're gonna have 
with our crab and then we're just gonna have it

with some rice as per usual for any time you and 
that is it some seafood for lunch today and for

lunch dessert lunch there's dessert for every 
meal we're having fascicle which is normally a

breakfast thing but this is a particularly 
large fat uncle and it's basically like a

beignet but better because it's it's Chinese 
doughnut a lot of you know it's crispy on

the outside and fluffy and holy on the inside 
and you dip this in sweetened condensed milk

this is by no means something that I eat every 
day nor is it something easy to find but here is

a thinking a cricket that I am about to eat the 
first time in my life on camera here we go David
